description.narrative: The objective of the Second Programmatic Competitiveness Development Policy Operation Program is to strengthen the competitiveness of FYR Macedonia's economy by incentivizing productive investment and technology upgrading in the manufacturing, agribusiness and trade logistics sectors, and establishing enabling conditions to progressively increase labor market flexibility and innovation capacity. The Second Programmatic Competitiveness Development Policy Loan (DPL2) to the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia (FYR Macedonia) supports the government's competitiveness development agenda. It will be the second of two DPLs in FYR Macedonia aimed at strengthening key export-oriented economic sectors with strong potential for growth and employment. Building on the reforms supported by the First Programmatic Competitiveness DPL (DPL1), the operation advances the competitiveness agenda and intensifies its impact on poverty reduction and shared prosperity in several important ways. It puts emphasis on reforms to incentivize greenfield investment in manufacturing, which can boost demand for both low skilled and high skilled workers. It promotes agribusiness development through improved management of state-owned agricultural land. It supports the introduction of a risk-based approach to customs inspections to significantly reduce the time and cost of international trade. It also supports labor market reforms that improve the incentives to work. Finally, it supports more new policies to stimulate growth of Research and Development (R&D)-intensive industries.

title.narrative: Average waiting time at the border from arrival to release of goods: Transit, Import, Export

comment.narrative: Transit: 60 minutes Import: 1 hr 57 minutesExport: 35 minutes

actual.value: transit: 2015 (Q1):56 minutes (7% reduction)Import: 2015 (Q1): 1 hr 21 min (31% reduction)Export: 2014: 30 minutes (17%reduction)

comment.narrative: Status: The public review procedure for the Program for Sale of State Owned Agricultural Land completed. The auction for 85 stateowned agriculture land properties included in the Program is expected to be advertised by end November 2014.

FITD is operational and has launched the first calls for proposals.

target.value: The Fund is operational (structure, staff, and financial management capacity are in place) and 50 companies have applied forfinancing.

actual.value: The Fund for Innovations and Technology Development has been established in 2013. In 2014 Fund for Innovations and TechnologyDevelopment established its structure, staff and financial management. Fund for Innovations and Technology Development launched thefirst call for proposal for the first instrument Co-financing grants for start-up, spin-off companies and innovations in February2015. On this call 78 companies applied, 34 were preselected and 16 were selected for financing. Contracts for financial supportwith these 16 companies were signed on 22.06.2015. The total amount for financing these 16 selected projects by the Fund forInnovations and Technology Development is 458.700,50 Euros.

title.narrative: Sampling rate for physical inspections and laboratory testing for low and medium risk products traded across borders.

actual.value: FVA: 7% (a 68% reduction)SSHI: 12.5% (78.1% reduction)The indicator for SSHI covers goods of all risk levels; so the reductionin the sampling rate for low and medium risk products is even higher.

comment.narrative: on track, based on informal reports.
